channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Company that has distributed millions of personality tests shares 4 potential questions, and what they will and won’t reveal
item.description: An expert said not all personality assessments are created equal, and provides some legitimate questions to plan ahead for.

item.title: Who Is Friedrich Merz, the Man Poised to Be Germany’s Next Chancellor?
item.description: Friedrich Merz, head of the conservative Christian Democrats, has vowed to bring stronger leadership to Europe, where the new Trump administration has...

item.title: xAI chief engineer blames former OpenAI employee after Grok blocks results saying Musk and Trump ‘spread misinformation’
item.description: xAI is blaming a former Open-AI employee after Grok briefly censored responses about Elon Musk and Donald Trump.

item.title: Kenyan Police Officer Deployed to Tackle Gangs in Haiti Killed
item.description: The officer’s death appeared to be the first among the Kenyan forces that were sent to Haiti last year as part of an international effort to subdue ga...

item.title: Republicans Face Backlash, and the Dangers of Fake A.I. Therapists
item.description: Plus, is the daytime soap opera back?

item.title: Exclusive: IT software startup NinjaOne raises $500 million led by CapitalG and Iconiq
item.description: How two childhood friends founded the ‘next Crowdstrike,’ now valued at $5 billion.

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Could End in Days, With No Extension Agreed. What Happens Next?
item.description: Less than a week before it expires, Israel and Hamas have failed to agree to extend the cease-fire in Gaza. Here’s how the deal could still continue —...

item.title: Germany Election Maps: How Conservatives Regained Power
item.description: Maps show how every district in Germany voted. The conservative Christian Democrats have won the most seats while the far-right AfD placed second.

item.title: When Warren Buffett bought an obscure RV maker he promised to pay the CEO whatever he asked—it’s not a tactic Buffett recommends, but the gamble paid off

item.title: Is Zelensky’s Approach to Trump Hurting Ukraine?
item.description: Through three years of wartime leadership, Ukraine’s president has mostly played weak hands wisely. But his approach has fallen flat with the Trump ad...

item.title: The Meaning of Germany’s Election
item.description: We examine the role of immigration in the outcome.

item.title: North Koreans on Chinese Tuna Boats Boost Revenue for Kim Jong-un
item.description: Thousands of miles from home, North Koreans work on Chinese tuna longliners in the Indian Ocean for pay that goes to their leader, a new study says.

item.title: $80 million for a CEO-in-waiting? Banks are paying top dollar to keep talent
item.description: Goldman Sachs awarded its COO, widely viewed to be the next CEO, an $80 million retention bonus if he stays for five more years.
